newsitem.title: RUSSIA: IMF to use November data for Russian loan decision.
newsitem.headline: IMF to use November data for Russian loan decision.

text.p: The International Monetary Fund will base a decision on whether to pay out the latest tranche of Russia's $10 billion IMF loan on Russian economic data for November, Central Bank Chairman Sergei Dubinin said on Tuesday.
This information will be available from December 1, he told a news conference.
"We agreed that only the results of November, on December 1, will help the mission reach a conclusion of its monitoring and a recommendation for the IMF board of directors," he said.
"We hope for a successful conclusion to the mission's work and a positive decision by the IMF board."
An IMF mission left Moscow on Tuesday for the second time in two months without deciding whether to recommend payment of the tranche.
Russian and IMF officials said they would be back next month.
The mission last month did not recommend disbursing the money because it was concerned about tax shortfalls.
Russian officials say revenues have picked up in the last few months, but the Fund wants evidence that the recovery in tax collection is sustainable and not a one-off event.
